decks.notes: The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly develop a strong board presence using efficient creatures like Mosswood Dreadknight and Tranquil Frillback, supported by mana dorks such as Llanowar Elves. Removal spells like Go for the Throat and Maelstrom Pulse help control the opponent's board while threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Vraska, Betrayal's Sting apply pressure. Restless Cottage provides recursion and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and powerful threats, backed up by a versatile suite of removal and disruption.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by efficiently dealing damage to opponents with cheap spells and creatures. Utilizing a mix of burn spells and powerful creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly before they can establish their own game plan. By curving out with low-cost creatures and supporting them with removal spells, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game swiftly. The inclusion of mana-fixing lands ensures consistency in casting spells and maintaining a fast pace of gameplay.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The strategy involves utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Llanowar Elves and Up the Beanstalk to get ahead on board presence and apply pressure with cards like Terror of the Peaks and Overlord of the Boilerbilges. The deck also includes burn spells like Scorching Dragonfire and Torch the Tower to deal with opposing threats and keep the pressure on. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly by efficiently using its creatures and removal spells.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent using a combination of creatures with evasive abilities and removal spells to control the board. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game with creatures like Hopeless Nightmare and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Nowhere to Run and Go for the Throat. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, allowing for consistent casting of spells while minimizing the risk of being mana flooded or color screwed.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The Gruul color combination allows for a fast and powerful early game, with creatures like Witchstalker Frenzy and Emberheart Challenger leading the charge. The burn spells like Burst Lightning and Obliterating Bolt help control the board and finish off opponents. Innkeeper's Talent and Monstrous Rage provide additional buffs to your creatures, giving them an edge in combat. With a solid mana base and plenty of aggressive creatures, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.
